org.wtc.eclipse.platform.helpers
Interface IWorkbenchHelper

public interface IWorkbenchHelper

Helper workbench specific tasks.

Method Detail

addExpectedJob

void addExpectedJob(java.lang.String jobTitle)
addExpectedJob - Add a Job by the given title to the list of expected jobs when waitNoJobs is called. An expected job means that when waitNoJobs is called (waitNoJobs waits until all of the Jobs in the JobManager are SLEEPING or STOPPING) the Job with that title can be considered a RUNNING job and the condition can still be met

Parameters:
jobTitle - - Expected Job

bringToFront

void bringToFront(IUIContext ui)
bringToFront - Bring the active workbench to the front.

Parameters:
ui - - Driver for UI generated input

buildProject

void buildProject(IUIContext ui,
                  java.lang.String projectName,
                  boolean fullBuild)
buildProject - Explicitly executes a build of the specified type and waits for the build to complete (@see #waitForBuild for deadlock warning; won't wait if auto-build is disabled). Issues a TestCase failure if the project does not exist or an unexpected build error occurs (build problem markers will not trigger a failure).

Parameters:
ui - - Driver for UI generated input
projectName - - The name of the project in the workspace to build. Should not be null.
fullBuild - True to trigger an IncrementalProjectBuilder.FULL_BUILD, false to trigger an IncrementalProjectBuilder.INCREMENTAL_BUILD.

cleanAllProjects

void cleanAllProjects(IUIContext ui)
cleanAllProjects - Use the project -> clean menu to clean all projects. Wait for the auto build jobs to complete before returning

Parameters:
ui - - Driver for UI generated input

cleanBuildProject

void cleanBuildProject(IUIContext ui,
                       java.lang.String projectName)
cleanBuildProject - Explicitly executes a clean build (which is a clean then a full build) of the given project in the workspace. (@see #waitForBuild for deadlock warning; won't wait if auto-build is disabled). Issues a TestCase failure if the project does not exist or an unexpected build error occurs (build problem markers will not trigger a failure).

Parameters:
ui - - Driver for UI-generated input
projectName - - Name of the project in the workspace to clean and build

IEditorPart getActiveEditor()

Returns:

getActiveEditorComposite

Composite getActiveEditorComposite()
getActiveEditorComposite - Get the active editor based on the active workbench window, then find the edit part and grab the Composite parent from that edit part.

THIS IS A PRETTY SKETCHY METHOD AND IS ONLY USED IN THE RARE CASES WHERE WE WANT TO MANIPULATE EDITORS WITH WIDGETS

Returns:
Composite - The active composite for the IEditorPart, or null if no editors are active.

verifyBuild

void verifyBuild(IUIContext ui,
                 java.lang.String projectName)
verifyBuild - Explicitly executes a full build on the project, waits for the build job to complete (@see #waitForBuild for deadlock warning; won't wait if auto-build is disabled) and verifies that the project in the workspace with the given name has no errors by checking the known error markers for the project. If the project does not exist or contains errors, then this method will issue a TestCase failure

Parameters:
ui - - Driver for UI generated input
projectName - - The name of the project in the workspace to verify. Should not be null

verifyBuild

void verifyBuild(IUIContext ui,
                 java.lang.String projectName,
                 boolean fullBuild,
                 boolean shouldPass)
verifyBuild- Explicitly executes a build of the specified type, waits for the build to complete (@see #waitForBuild for deadlock warning; won't wait if auto-build is disabled), and then verifies if the build succeeded or failed, as specified. Issues a TestCase failure if the project does not exist or the specified build conditions are not met.

Parameters:
ui - - Driver for UI generated input
projectName - - The name of the project in the workspace to verify. Should not be null.
fullBuild - True to trigger an IncrementalProjectBuilder.FULL_BUILD, false to trigger an IncrementalProjectBuilder.INCREMENTAL_BUILD.
shouldPass - True if there should be no error problem marker on the project after the build completes. False if there should be at least one error problem marker on the project after the build completes.

verifyMarkers

void verifyMarkers(IUIContext ui,
                   java.lang.String projectName,
                   IWorkbenchHelper.MarkerInfo[] markerInfos)
verifyMarkers - Verifies that the project has (or does not have) problem markers with the specified details. If necessary, callers must execute and wait for a build prior to calling this method. Generates a TestCase failure if the conditions are not met.

Parameters:
ui - - Driver for UI generated input
projectName - - Source of the project to verify
markerInfos - - Describes the markers that should Marker type to check

verifyMarkerType

void verifyMarkerType(java.lang.String projectName,
                      java.lang.String type,
                      boolean checkOnlyErrors,
                      boolean shouldHaveMarkers)
verifyMarkerType - Verifies that the project has (or does not have) a marker of the specified type. If necessary, callers must execute and wait for a build prior to calling this method. Generates a TestCase failure if the conditions are not met.

Parameters:
projectName - - Source of the project to verify
type - Marker type to check
onlyCheckErrors - True to only check problem markers with severity error.
shouldHaveMarkers - True if the project should

waitForBuild

void waitForBuild(IUIContext ui)
waitForBuild - Waits until all jobs of the build family are finished. This method will block the calling thread until all such jobs have finished executing. If there are no jobs in the family that are currently waiting, running, or sleeping, this method returns immediately. If a job is canceled a runtime exception will be thrown.

Note that there is a deadlock risk when using join. If the calling thread owns a lock or object monitor that the joined thread is waiting for, deadlock will occur. This method can also result in starvation of the current thread if another thread continues to add jobs of the given family, or if a job in the given family reschedules itself in an infinite loop.

Parameters:
ui - - Driver for UI generated input

waitForBuild

void waitForBuild(IUIContext ui,
                  IWorkbenchHelper.JobWaitType type)
Parameters:
ui - - Driver for UI generated input
type - - The job wait type.

waitForBuild

void waitForBuild(IUIContext ui,
                  long timeout,
                  int pollingInterval)
waitForBuild - Waits until all jobs of the build family are finished. This method will block the calling thread until all such jobs have finished executing. If there are no jobs in the family that are currently waiting, running, or sleeping, this method returns immediately. If a job is canceled a runtime exception will be thrown.

Note that there is a deadlock risk when using join. If the calling thread owns a lock or object monitor that the joined thread is waiting for, deadlock will occur. This method can also result in starvation of the current thread if another thread continues to add jobs of the given family, or if a job in the given family reschedules itself in an infinite loop.

Parameters:
ui - - Driver for UI generated input
timeout - - How long (in ms) to wait for the job activity to settle down before marking the test as a failure.
pollingInverval - - How long (in ms) to wait between each test of the job activity. Should be proportional to the timeout (ie- a ten minute timeout (600000) should not check every 100ms.

waitForBuild

void waitForBuild(IUIContext ui,
                  IWorkbenchHelper.JobWaitType type,
                  long timeout,
                  int pollingInterval)
Parameters:
ui - - Driver for UI generated input
type - - The job wait type.

waitForJobFamily

void waitForJobFamily(IUIContext ui,
                      java.lang.Object family)
waitForJobFamily - Waits for jobs in the specified family to finish. Job does not necessarily have to run but repeated checks are made for it.

Parameters:
ui - Driver for UI generated input
family - Job family. Cannot be null.
See Also:
for deadlock warning

waitForJobFamily

void waitForJobFamily(IUIContext ui,
                      java.lang.Object family,
                      IWorkbenchHelper.JobWaitType type)
Parameters:
ui - Driver for UI generated input
family - Job family. Cannot be null.
jobWaitType - Either RETURN_IF_NO_JOBS, WAIT_FOR_JOBS or JOB_MUST_RUN.

waitNoJobs

void waitNoJobs(IUIContext ui)
waitNoJobs - Wait for the eclipse JobManager to have only sleeping or stopping jobs. A running job is anything that was scheduled through the Job.schedule() call. Use the default exclusion list for jobs that are allowed to run under any circumstance.

Parameters:
ui - - Driver for UI generated input
See Also:
for deadlock warning.

Use the default timeout and polling interval

waitNoJobs

void waitNoJobs(IUIContext ui,
                long timeout,
                int pollingInterval)
waitNoJobs - Wait for the eclipse JobManager to have only sleeping or stopping jobs. A running job is anything that was scheduled through the Job.schedule() call. Use the default exclusion list for jobs that are allowed to run under any circumstance.

Parameters:
ui - - Driver for UI generated input
timeout - - How long (in ms) to wait for the job activity to settle down before marking the test as a failure.
pollingInverval - - How long (in ms) to wait between each test of the job activity. Should be proportional to the timeout (ie- a ten minute timeout (600000) should not check every 100ms.
See Also:
for deadlock warning

waitNoResourceChangeEvents

void waitNoResourceChangeEvents(IUIContext ui)
waitNoResourceChangeEvents - Wait for the eclipse resource changed event broadcaster to stop. For each resource changed event that is broadcast, this condition will reset a timer. This wait will return when that timer expires. In other words, wait for all resource change events to stop then wait the given timeout value after the last resource changed event to make sure no new events are broadcast. By default, use a 6 second timeout

Parameters:
ui - - Driver for UI generated input

waitNoResourceChangeEvents

void waitNoResourceChangeEvents(IUIContext ui,
                                int timeout)
waitNoResourceChangeEvents - Wait for the eclipse resource changed event broadcaster to stop. For each resource changed event that is broadcast, this condition will reset a timer. This wait will return when that timer expires. In other words, wait for all resource change events to stop then wait the given timeout value after the last resource changed event to make sure no new events are broadcast.

Parameters:
ui - - Driver for UI generated input
timeout - - How long to wait after the last resource changed event
